contentList.content: You learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the warlock class.
Studying occult lore, you have unlocked eldritch power within yourself.

Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain Proficiency in one skill, and your Proficiency Bonus is doubled in another of your choice.

You learn Misty Step and a Level 1 spell from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Intelligence score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Intelligence.

You learn Misty Step and a Level 1 spell from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Wisdom score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Wisdom.

You learn Misty Step and a Level 1 spell from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Charisma score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Charisma.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you.

You learn Invisibility and a Level 1 spell from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Intelligence score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Intelligence.

You learn Invisibility and a Level 1 spell from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Wisdom score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Wisdom.

You learn Invisibility and a Level 1 spell from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Charisma score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Charisma.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you.

Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 1.5m to an unoccupied space. When you score a Critical Hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with Advantage until the start of your next turn.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you push it back 1.5m.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.

Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result. When you score a Critical Hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> that deals piercing damage to a creature, you roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.

Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 3m until the start of your next turn. When you score a Critical Hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has Disadvantage on all attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 50% until the start of your next turn.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on all attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
You learn one Fighting Style option of your choice from the fighter class.
Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting.

You learn two Metamagic options of your choice from the sorcerer class and gain 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> to fuel them. You regain expended Sorcery Points after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

You learn the Mage Hand cantrip, can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and make it invisible. You also learn the Telekinetic: Push and Telekinetic: Pull actions.
You have learned to cast the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand">Mage Hand</LSTag> cantrip without verbal or somatic components, and the hand is invisible.
As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can telekinetically shove a creature away from you.
As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can telekinetically shove a creature towards you.

When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lighting, or Poison damage, once per Short Rest you can use your reaction to give yourself Resistance to that damage type until the start of your next turn.

You also learn the Chromatic Infusion action, and can use it once per Long Rest.
Gift of the Chromatic Dragon: Chromatic Infusion
You touch a weapon and infuse it with Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals additional damage of the chosen type.
Gift of the Chromatic Dragon: Reactive Resistance

When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lighting, or Poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to that damage until the start of your next turn. Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.

Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

When you take damage from a creature within 3m of you, you can use your reaction to deal force damage and attempt to push the creature away.
Gift of the Gem Dragon: Telekinetic Reprisal
When you take damage from a creature within 3m of you, you can use your reaction to deal [1] force damage and attempt to push the creature away.

You learn the Cure Wounds spell, and can cast it without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest.

When you are hit by an Attack Roll, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus to your Armour Class equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
Gift of the Metallic Dragon: Draconic Healing
You've learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CureWounds">Cure Wounds</LSTag> spell, and can cast it without expending a spell slot once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Gift of the Metallic Dragon: Protective Wings

When you are hit by an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.

Your Intelligence or Wisdom increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Investigation and Perception Checks.

You're quick to notice the details of your environment. Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is also doubled for Investigation and Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.
You gain the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_InspiringLeader">Inspiring Leader</LSTag> action.
You have learned to inspire your allies, shoring up their resolve to fight.
Number of charges equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.

Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> by 1, to a maximum of 20. Once per turn, when you hit a creature that deals bludgeoning damage, you move it 2m away from you, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.
Also, when you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against that creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.

Studying occult lore, you have unlocked eldritch power within yourself: you learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the Warlock class.If you already have an Invocation, the one you choose must be different.

Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> score by 1.
You also learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MistyStep_FeyTouched">Misty Step</LSTag> spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Modifier</LSTag> is the ability increased by this feat.

Prerequisite: Proficiency with a martial weapon
You learn one Fighting Style option of your choice from the Fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
You’ve manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

As an action, you can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Healer_Heal">Heal</LSTag> another creature. That creature can't regain hit points in this way again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
You can spend 10 minutes <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_InspiringLeader">Inspiring</LSTag> your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight.

Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature
You learn two Metamagic options of your choice from the sorcerer class. You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless the option says otherwise. You also gain 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> to spend on Metamagic. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1.
You also learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Invisibility">Invisibility</LSTag> spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Modifier</LSTag> is the ability increased by this feat.

Increase one <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain one <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in one skill of your choice, and gain <LSTag Tooltip="Expertise">Expertise</LSTag> in one skill of your choice.

Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> by 1, to a maximum of 20. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack that deals slashing damage, you reduce the target's <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">speed</LSTag> by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
Also, when you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on all attack rolls.

You learn to move things with your mind. Increase the <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">spell DC</LSTag>.

As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type when it hits.
After you use this bonus action, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you move it away from you, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against that creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1.

As an action, you can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Healer_Heal">Heal</LSTag> another creature. That creature can't regain hit points in this way again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Unlocks the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_InspiringLeader">Inspiring</LSTag> spell, which gives all friendly creatures (including yourself) within 9m of you 5 <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>.

You gain 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> to spend on Metamagic. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1 .

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack that deals slashing damage, you reduce the <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">speed</LSTag> of the target by 3m until the start of your next turn.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on all attack rolls.

Increase the chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1. You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the spell DC.

Increase the chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1. You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the spell DC.

Increase the chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1. You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the spell DC.

When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

All creatures (including yourself) within [1] of you gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">Temporary Hit Points</LSTag> equal to your current level plus your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. You cannot inspire again until after a short or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>

You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] of the chosen type when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with acid. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with cold. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with fire. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with lightning. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can tend to a creature's wounds. You restore [1] to it. That creature can't regain hit points in this way again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
You learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components.
You try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within [1] of you. They must succeed on a Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be pushed [2] away from you.
You try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within [1] of you. They must succeed on a Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be pulled [2] toward you.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
<LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against this creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn
This creature can't regain hit points via the Healer feat again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Each creature gains 5 <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>.
Resistant to Acid for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Cold for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Fire for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Lightning for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Poison for one instance of damage.
Can't use again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you |Large size or smaller|.
Focus on defending yourself and avoiding incoming strikes. Attacks against you are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> until the start of your next turn.

Prerequisite: Dwarf
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Whenever you take the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dodge">Dodge</LSTag> action during combat, you can regain a number of hit points equal to your Hit Die + your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> (minimum of 1).

Prerequisite: Elf or Half-Elf
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> you can reroll one of the dice.

Your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> score is increased by 1, to a maximum of 20. Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> you can reroll one of the dice.

Your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> score is increased by 1, to a maximum of 20. Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> you can reroll one of the dice.

Your <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score is increased by 1, to a maximum of 20. Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> you can reroll one of the dice.

Your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score is increased by 1, to a maximum of 20. Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> you can reroll one of the dice.

Prerequisite: Tiefling
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to cold damage and poison damage. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag>.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to poison damage
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to cold damage

Prerequisite: Tiefling
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> fire damage for a spell you cast, you can reroll the fire damage dice, but you must use the new roll.
Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can wrap yourself in an <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Fire_Aura">Aura of Fire</LSTag>.

Prerequisite: Dwarf or a Small race
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by 5 feet. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in the <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag> skill. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on any Athletics or Acrobatics check you make to escape from being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag>.

Prerequisite: Half-Elf
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="Deception">Deception</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Persuasion">Persuasion</LSTag>. If you’re already proficient in either skill, your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is doubled for any check you make with that skill.

You gain 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LuckPoint">Luck Points</LSTag>. Whenever you make an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20. You can also spend one luck point when an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> is made against you. In combat you activate your luck. Until your next turn you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on attack rolls, ability checks or saving throws.
Your enemies have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on their attack rolls against you. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled. You regain your expended luck points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Until your next turn you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Your enemies have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on their attack rolls against you. You regain your expended luck points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Your attacks and spells ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to poison damage. You can coat a weapon in poison as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
You are able to use a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Summon_PoisonersKit">Poisoner's Kit</LSTag>.

Poisoner's Kit. Combine with items to create poisons and other items. PoisonerKit + Basic Poison = Wyvern Poison; PoisonerKit + Wyvern Poison = Drow Poison; PoisonerKit + Healing Potion = Basic Poison (2), + Greater Healing = Basic Poison (4)
Weapons coated with Drow Assassin Poison deal an extra 1d6 of poison damage for a period of one minute.
Weapons coated with Magic Drow Assassin Poison deal an extra 1d6 of NECROTIC poison damage for a period of one minute.

Magic Poisoner's Kit. Combine with items to create poisons and other items. MagicPoisonerKit + Basic Poison = Magic Drow Assassin Poison (Necrotic Dmg); MagicPoisonerKit + Healing Potion = Basic Poison (2), MagicPoisonerKit+ Greater Healing = Basic Poison (4)

Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature
You learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the Warlock class.

Prerequisite: Dexterity 13 or higher
You can try to hide when you are only <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING_LIGHTLY_OBSCURED">Lightly Obscured</LSTag>.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attacks</LSTag>, your attack doesn't reveal your position.
Dim light doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> made with sight.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag>

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in the Acrobatics skill. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LsTag> on any Athletics or Acrobatics <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> you make to escape from being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag>.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in the Athletics skill. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LsTag> on any Athletics or Acrobatics <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> you make to escape from being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag>.

You can try to hide when you are only <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING_LIGHTLY_OBSCURED">Lightly Obscured</LSTag>.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attacks</LSTag>, your attack doesn't reveal your position.
Dim light doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> made with sight.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attack</LSTag>, your attack doesn't reveal your position.
In dim light you have advantage on perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag>.
In dim light you have advantage on stealth <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag>.
A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons
A magic poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons that do necrotic damage

You gain the following benefits: Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by 5 feet.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in the Acrobatics skill. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Sdvantage">Advantage</LsTag> on any Athletics or Acrobatics <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> you make to escape from being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag>.

You gain the following benefits: Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by 5 feet.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in the Athletics skill. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Sdvantage">Advantage</LsTag> on any Athletics or Acrobatics <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> you make to escape from being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag>.

Until the start of your next turn, any <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> made against you has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
When you take the dodge action you also regain [1].

Prerequisite:Dragonborn
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, up to a maximum of 20. While you aren't wearing armor, you can calculate your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">AC</LSTag> as 13 + your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> modifier.
You can grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DragonHide_Melee">Unarmed Strikes</LSTag>.
While you aren't wearing armor, you can calculate your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">AC</LSTag> as 13 + your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> modifier.

Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have a +5 bonus to your Perception and Investigation scores.

Prerequisite: Elf (Wood)
You learn one Druid <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrip</LSTag> of your choice. You also learn <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Longstrider">Longstrider</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_PassWithoutTrace">Pass Without Trace</LSTag>, each of which you can cast once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Wisdom.
You can grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DragonHide_Melee">Unarmed Strikes</LSTag>.

Your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> score is increased by 1, to a maximum of 20. Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> you can reroll one of the dice.

Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> using <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag>, you can reroll one of the dice.

Increase one <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20. You gain proficiency in one <LSTag Tooltip="Skill">Skill</LSTag> of your choice.
Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Expertise">Expertise</LSTag> with that skill. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.
A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons.

You can try to hide when you are only <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING_LIGHTLY_OBSCURED">Lightly Obscured</LSTag>.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attacks</LSTag>, your attack doesn't reveal your position.
Dim light doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> made with sight Implementation: If you miss a ranged attack you will try to hide. You have advantage on perception and stealth checks when obscured. If you start combat by attacking you have all your actions when combat starts.

Prerequisite: Halfling Fortune favors you when someone tries to strike you. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When a creature you can see hits you with an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to force that creature to reroll. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until you roll initiative at the start of combat or until you finish a short or long rest.

Prerequisite: Half-orc
Your fury burns tirelessly. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
When you hit with a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee Weapon Attack</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged Weapon Attack</LSTag> you can roll one of the weapon’s damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the weapon’s damage type. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Immediately after you use your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="RelentlessEndurance">Relentless Endurance</LSTag>, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to make one weapon attack.
When you hit with a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee Weapon Attack</LSTag> deal additional [1]
When you hit with a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged Weapon Attack</LSTag> deal additional [1]

You’ve learned some of an artificer’s inventiveness:
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Artificer spell list, and you learn one 1st-level spell of your choice from that list. It uses your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> as its <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">modifier</LSTag>. You can cast this feat's 1st-level spell without a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag>, and you must finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> you have. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with one type of artisan's tools of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> as its spellcasting ability.

Absorb elemental damage once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Take half damage from the next elemental attack targetting you, and deal an additional [1] of that element type on your next attack.

Prerequisite: Gnome
Your people are clever, with a knack for illusion magic. You have learned a magical trick for fading away when you suffer harm. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your Dexterity or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Immediately after you take damage, you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to magically become <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Invisibility">Invisible</LSTag> until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Your body has the ability to recover quickly from terrible injuries, and is unusually receptive to healing magic. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. When you are successfully stabilized while dying, you regain <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier (minimum of 1). Whenever you regain <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> as a result of a spell, potion, or class feature (but not this feat), you regain additional hit points equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier (minimum of 1).

Prerequisite: Gnome (Deep Gnome)
You have inherited the innate spellcasting ability of your ancestors. This ability allows you to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Nondetection">Nondetection</LSTag> on yourself at will, without needing a material component.
You can also cast each of the following spells once with this ability: <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Blindness">Blindness</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Blur">Blur</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DisguiseSelf">Disguise Self</LSTag>. You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> is your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">modifier</LSTag>for these spells

Time and effort spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with cook’s utensils if you don’t already have it. As part of a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, you can cook special food, provided you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. At the end of the <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points regains an extra 1d8 hit points. With one hour of work or when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, you can cook a number of treats equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> to eat one of those treats to gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.

As part of a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, you can cook special food, provided you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. At the end of the <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points regains an extra hit points.

With one hour of work or when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, you can cook a number of treats equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> to eat one of those treats to gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> you can summon food, lasting until a long rest. When consumed and the character takes a short rest they regain an extra 1d8 hit points.

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> you can summon food, lasting until a long rest. Once consumed the character gains <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>
When consumed and the character takes a short rest they regain an extra 1d8 hit points.
Once consumed the character gains <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>
Use this version of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DisguiseSelf">Disguise Self</LSTag> and then Dismiss will unlock the full version of the spell.

Prerequisite: Halfling
Your people have extraordinary luck, which you have learned to mystically lend to your companions whenever you see them falter. You're not sure how you do it, you just wish it, and it happens. Surely a sign of fortune's favor!
When an ally you can see within 30 feet of you rolls a 1 on the d20 for an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to let the ally reroll the die. The ally must use the new roll. When you use this ability, you can't use your Lucky racial trait before the end of your next turn
When you use this ability, you can't use your Lucky racial trait before the end of your next turn

Source: Tasha's Cauldron of Everything
You have a quick hand and keen eye when employing firearms, granting you the following benefits: Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with firearms. You ignore the loading property of firearms. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on your ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.

Toggle on to remove <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> from making a ranged spell attack whilst in melee combat |Toggle on to use <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeSpellAttack">Melee Spell Attack</LSTag> roll instead of <LSTag Tooltip="RangedSpellAttack">Ranged Spell Attack</LSTag> roll |

Source: Bigby Presents - Glory of the Giants
Prerequisite: 4th Level, Strike of the Giants (Cloud Strike) Feat
You’ve manifested the confounding magic emblematic of cloud giants, granting you the following benefits:
Ability Score Increase. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Cloudy Escape. When a creature you can see hits you with an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to give yourself resistance to that attack’s damage. You then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You can use this <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
You can teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 metres.

When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that attack’s damage. You then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of yourself.
As a free action end Cloudy Escape

Source: Bigby Presents - Glory of the Giants
Prerequisite: Martial Weapon Proficiency or Giant Foundling Background
You have absorbed primeval magic that gives you an echo of the might of giants. When you take this feat, choose one of the benefits. Once per turn, when you hit a target with a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee Weapon Attack</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged Weapon Attack</LSTag> using a <LSTag Tooltip="Thrown">Thrown</LSTag> weapon, you can imbue the attack with an additional effect depending on the benefit you chose:
Cloud Strike, Fire Strike, Frost Strike, Hill Strike, Stone Strike, or Storm Strike.
The saving throw DC for these effects equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier.
You can use this feat a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

The target takes an extra 1d4 thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or you become invisible to it until the start of your next turn or until immediately after you make an attack roll or cast a spell.
The target takes an extra 1d10 fire damage.

The target takes an extra 1d6 cold damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

The target takes an extra 1d6 damage of the weapon’s type. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or have the prone condition.

The target takes an extra 1d6 force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be pushed 10 feet from you in a straight line.

The target takes an extra 1d6 lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
The Cloudstrike Target has disadvantage to attack this character until the start of your next turn or until immediately after you make an attack roll or cast a spell.
This character has disadvantage on attack rolls against the Cloudstrike Attacker

When you use the Attack action and attack with a one handed weapon, you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> to attack with a hand crossbow you are holding in your mainhand.

Prerequisite: 4th Level, Strike of the Giants (Fire Strike) Feat
You've manifested the fiery combat emblematic of fire giants, granting you the following benefits: Ability Score Increase. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Born of Flame. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Fire Resistance</LSTag> to fire damage. Searing Ignition. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace a single attack with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> saving throw (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to ld8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and it has the blinded condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> (but no more than once per turn), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Prerequisite: 4th Level, Strike of the Giants (Frost Strike) Feat
You've manifested the icy might emblematic of frost giants, granting you the following benefits: Ability Score Increase. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Born of Ice. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Cold Resistance</LSTag> to cold damage. Frigid Retaliation. Immediately after a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack roll and deals damage, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a conjured blast of ice. The creature must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes cold damage equal to ld8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and its speed is reduced to O until the end of its next turn. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

You've manifested the physical talents emblematic of stone giants, granting you the following benefits: Ability Score Increase. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Cavernous Sight. You gain darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from another source, its range increases by 60 feet. Stone Throw. As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can take a rock and make a magical attack with it. The attack is a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet that uses the ability score you increased with this feat as the spellcasting ability. On a hit, the rock deals ldl0 force damage, and the target must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the spellcasting ability modifier) or have the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> condition. You can use this <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Prerequisite: Spellcasting Feature or Rune Carver Background
You've studied the magic of Giant runes, granting you the following benefits: Comprehend Languages. You learn the comprehend languages spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have. Rune Magic. You know a number of runes equal to half your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> (rounds down), chosen from the Rune Spells table. Whenever you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, you can inscribe each rune you know onto one nonmagical weapon, armor, piece of clothing, or other object you touch. You temporarily learn the 1st-level spells that correspond to the runes you inscribed, as specified on the Rune Spells table, and you know those spells until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, when the runes fade. While you are wearing or carrying any rune-marked object, you can cast the spells associated with those runes using any spell slots you have.
You can also invoke a rune inscribed on an object you are wearing or carrying and cast its associated spell without expending a spell slot or using material components. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your spellcasting ability for this feat is <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> (choose when you select this feat).
Each time you gain a level, you can replace one of the runes you know with another one from the Rune Spells table.

Prerequisite: 4th Level, Strike of the Giants (Storm Strike) Feat
You've manifested the tempest magic emblematic of storm giants, granting you the following benefits: Ability Score Increase. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Maelstrom Aura. As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you surround yourself with an aura of magical wind and lightning that extends 10 feet from you in every direction but not through total cover. The aura lasts until the start of your next turn or unitl you are incapacitated. While the aura is active, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, attack rolls against you have disadvantage, and whenever another creature starts its turn within the aura, you can force the creature to make a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat).
On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn. You can use this <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Prerequisite: 4th Level, Strike of the Giants (Hill Strike) Feat
You've manifested the resilience emblematic of hill giants, granting you the following benefits: Ability Score Increase. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Bulwark. When you are subjected to an effect that would move you at least 5 feet or give you the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> condition, you can use your reaction to steady yourself. You aren't moved and don't have the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> condition. Iron Stomach. Whenever you eat food as part of a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> and spend one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points, you regain additional hit points equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier+ your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
Born of Flame. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Fire Resistance</LSTag>.

Searing Ignition. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace a single attack with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> saving throw (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to ld8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and it has the blinded condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> (but no more than once per turn), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Ember Of The Fire Giant Resource
You regain all expanded uses when you finish a long rest.
Born of Ice. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Cold Resistance</LSTag>.

Frigid Retaliation. Immediately after a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack roll and deals damage, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a conjured blast of ice. The creature must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes cold damage equal to ld8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and its speed is reduced to O until the end of its next turn. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Fury of the Frost Giant Resource
Movement speed is reduced to zero until the end of its next turn.
You gain darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from another source, its range increases by 60 feet.

As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can take a rock and make a magical attack with it. The attack is a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet that uses the ability score you increased with this feat as the spellcasting ability. On a hit, the rock deals ldl0 force damage, and the target must succeed on a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the spellcasting ability modifier) or have the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> condition. You can use this <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Keenness of the Stone Giant Resource

When you are subjected to an effect that would move you at least 5 feet or give you the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> condition, you can use your reaction to steady yourself. You aren't moved and don't have the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> condition.

Whenever you eat food as part of a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> and spend one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points, you regain additional hit points equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier+ your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.

The aura lasts until the start of your next turn or until you are incapacitated. While the aura is active, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, attack rolls against you have disadvantage, and whenever another creature starts its turn within the aura, you can force the creature to make a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat).
On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn. You can use this <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Soul of the Storm Giant Resource

While the aura is active, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to lightning and thunder damage. On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn. You can use this <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Whenever another creature starts its turn within the aura, you can force the creature to make a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> (DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat).
On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn. You can use this <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
The creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn

You know a number of runes equal to half your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> (rounds down), chosen from the Rune Spells table. Whenever you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, you can inscribe each rune you know to summon an item into your inventory. You temporarily learn the 1st-level spells that correspond to the runes you inscribed, as specified on the Rune Spells table, and you know those spells until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, when the runes fade. While you are carrying the rune, you can cast the spells associated with those runes using any spell slots you have.|You can choose to inscribe any rune after a long rest|
You can also invoke a rune inscribed on an object you are carrying and cast its associated spell without expending a spell slot or using material components. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your spellcasting ability for this feat is <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> (choose when you select this feat).

You temporarily learn the 1st-level spells that correspond to the runes you inscribed (summoned and locked into your inventory), as specified on the Rune Spells table, and you know those spells until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, when the runes fade. While you are wearing or carrying any rune-marked object, you can cast the spells associated with those runes using any spell slots you have.
You can also invoke a rune inscribed on an object you are wearing or carrying and cast its associated spell without expending a spell slot or using material components. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your spellcasting ability for this feat is <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> (choose when you select this feat).
This rune is bound to your inventory

Whilst this rune is in your inventory you can cast the spell with your spellslots. You can also cast this spell without using a spellslot once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. The runes disappear after a long rest.
